Fields.DialogueText: Antoniotto.
Antoniotto!
What?
What's with the morale on the ship lately? I heard a fight broke out in the mess.
We're all on edge. Food supplies are running low. Not to mention the fact that we're defending ourselves from Morganas all the time.
Okay.
All I can think about is food and a glass of merlot.
We're tired, Capitano.
This isn't easy on anyone, but we have to keep going. We'll reach port before too much longer.
Spare the pep talk and give me a bread ration.
Antoniotto!
What will you have me do?

Fields.MenuText: Rally the crew with a speech.
Sing the crew a ballad of hope.
Honestly, I don't know...but you know them best.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not much for speeches...
I'm too hungry to sing.
I do, but I can only do so much.
You are their captain. The crew is loyal to the ship, but-
But?
Later. I feel something coming.
Morganas... damn. All right. But, Antoniotto, I need you to stay strong - for the crew's sake if not mine. We can get through this!
@BATTLE
Capitano!
Antoniotto? You're crying! What-
Raoul is ill! I thought he was acting odd yesterday...he must have been hiding it.
I went to check on him and he can barely sit up!
Ah, hell. Did you call the doctor down?
I did. They've taken him to the infirmary, but the doctor wants to talk to you.
Let's go.
Antoniotto. Captain.
Get right to it. How bad it it?
It's a bacterial infection, treatable with antibiotics. Raoul isn't the first - a couple other crewmen have caught it in the last few days.
And we shared our medical supplies with Montcalm before the standoff. Dammit.
We didn't give them everything we had. But if this keeps spreading I'll exhaust that supply before we can make port.
You're suggesting a quarantine?
Ship-wide if possible.
That will be hell for the crew.
They'll have to understand...this is life and death.
I know. So what about Raoul? Will he be all right?
If there are no delays and no great spread of the infection.
Captain, I confess, I hope it will not come to this...but if it gets worse I might have to make hard decisions about whom to treat.

Fields.MenuText: Do all you can to treat everyone.
I understand - save as many as you realistically can.
What does that mean?

Fields.DialogueText: I will try, but more may suffer if I am spread too thin.
Thank you, Captain.
It may seem backward, but in a crisis you treat the people most likely to survive first. In the time spent on the sickest, more are likely to worsen.
Capitano, radio report. Some Morganas are harassing a passenger liner. If we save them they might have medicine.
Let's get on it.
@BATTLE
Captain, we are under attack.
I know. All crew to your battle stations!
@BATTLE
All that wreckage in the water...if those other Morganas hadn't intercepted us...
Even then it was a long shot.
I see people in the water. Get crew out in rafts to search for survivors.
Captain... you know how limited our supplies are.
I know it will be a burden on the crew, but the Capitano's right. They'll take it worse if we sail away from this.
I know it makes things worse for Raoul, but...
...it might not make a difference.
Antoniotto, what aren't you telling me?
... I'm having boiler problems. I can hold things together in combat, but I think I can only really sustain about three-quarters speed.
Dammit.

Fields.MenuText: Bring the survivors on but put them on survival rations only.
Bring the survivors on, but they'll need to help with the fishing nets.
Bring the survivors on, but we'll have no choice but to cut everyone's rations.

Fields.DialogueText: That is harsh, but I suppose less so than leaving them in the water.
That's fair. We could use some able bodies.
It will be rough, but we must persevere.
Capitano, unless you need my help, I'm going to rest.
This must really be wearing her out...
Captain, we are taking heavy fire.
I know. We don't have a lot of options here.
@BATTLE
Antoniotto?
Antoniotto, I know you can hear me. You've barely spoken for two days and hardly anyone has seen you.
... Antoniotto, please?
Still no luck?
No. The sickness... we lost a sailor, Grace Scherf, to a complication. God, I barely knew her, but Antoniotto is somehow close to everybody.
And Raoul isn't doing that much better.
You could order her out...
I can't order her happy. She has so much to be miserable about... but I can't stand seeing her this low.
Well, keep trying.
I will. You get some rest.
Antoniotto...

Fields.MenuText: Sing for me. Please?
We managed to hide a couple bottles of wine from Gaspard. Want to share one?
I know it might not be fair, but the crew depends on you so much. We need you with us.

Fields.DialogueText: Look, I'll sing. You can join me.
Don't know why there's no sun up in the sky... Stormy weather, since my Belle and I aren't together...
Life is bare, gloom and mis'ry everywhere... Stormy weather, just can't get my poor self together, I'm weary all the time... so weary all the time...
I know. I know. Soon, I promise.
All I do is pray the Lord above will let me walk in the sun once more... Stormy weather, since I ain't got it together... keeps raining all the time.
Land in sight, finally.
Captain, we might need you to come down to the radio room.
We're talking with a harbor-master on the short-range. It's tricky because as far as Italy is concerned, we're landing in enemy territory.
You reminded them that the Zurich Agreement says that we're all on the same side?
At sea, yes - but they aren't going to be disposed to be friendly.
Did you tell them we're carrying shipwrecked civilians?
Yes; once they confirm it in person they'll at least take them.
Also, it is a small port. What we can get will be limited and they may ask us to pay for it.
Pay? With what?
Damned if I know.
Will they start with us taking care of the Morgana heading their way?
Good question. Let's see.
@BATTLE
Uuuugh.
*THUD*
That's my chai... rrrr... nevermind. Not important. You holding up?
Just. And Raoul and the other sick are... just.
Land in sight. Just keep thinking about that...
Shh. The Doctor's on the radio.
Look, Doctor, I know there's a war on, but you must have sworn the same oath I did...
I know you have to consider your people but our need is immediate. Seven people, all gone too long with insufficient treatment, who probably won't make it to the next port without this.
I understand. I will ask but I don't know where we'll get it. Please keep thinking about it. If there's anything else we can do...
*sigh* They want money for their medicine supply. It's not simple greed, they want assurances they'll be able to replace it. And they won't take an IOU.
All we have is petty cash and some salable scrap until we can reach a neutral port.
Capitano...
Antoniotto? You're shaking. What's in that bag?
That's... your jewelry...
Are you offering to sell it?
*nod*

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure? I can see this hurts you.
Are you sure? We might find another way...
Antoniotto...thank you.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't... don't make me explain.
Don't... I've thought this through.
Take it. Before I can change my mind. Send it with a runner.
And quickly. There are more Morganas in the area.
Well you all heard her. Doctor, get back on the radio. Davros, take this and see that it happens. I'll deal with the fighting.
@BATTLE
Oh. Capitano.
You're still quiet. How are you doing?
It worked. The doctor expects Raoul and the others to pull through.
Good. And good for you. That's the first smile I've seen from you in days.
*sigh* It still tears me up, giving so much.
It means that much to you?
It's like... giving up a part of me, in a way? But I have to keep telling myself I can get more jewelry.
But you can't replace lost friends.
Exactly. *sigh* Grace...

Fields.MenuText: Don't blame yourself for it. It was out of your control.
It was unfortunate, but all we can do is lay her to rest and move on.
I'm sorry... I wish I had known her better.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right... but it's terrible to feel powerless.
Maybe. It ought to be easier once we are through this mess.
Oh? Maybe it's not too late to do something about that... but later, once we're through this mess.
How long to Aden again?
Four days. We're stretching what rations we got but we'll make it.
We'll get our pay while we're there and the crew will get some shore leave while you get repairs.
How about we order in a nice feast? For us and anyone you want to invite.
Ahhh... that sounds wonderful. But stop there before you make me hungrier.
Oh... Morganas again. I am so tired of this. But we've got this handled, right, Capitano?
We do. Let's do it.
@BATTLE
Captain, I believe we've turned the tide.
Good. It's about time for our luck to change.
@BATTLE
Ah! Fully working propulsion again! I feel so much better!
Give my regards to the drydock crew!
*SINGING*
I'm glad, Antoniotto, but we're about to have company. An admiral from Command is on their way.
Oh dear. Are we in trouble?
I don't know. But best behavior, please?
Some Time Later
I've read your report, Captain. I've got a sympathetic ear; I realize you were weighing the risk against the safety of the ship and crew.
But in public opinion this pirate affair has blown up into an embarrassment to the Joint Fleet and some of the other Admirals want an inquiry, if not a court martial.

Fields.MenuText: We'd just had two lengthy battles with Morgana fleets. I didn't like letting Gaspard go, but I still don't see the alternative.
I'll cooperate with an inquiry if need be. I'm confident I'll be vindicated.
Ridiculous. I didn't do anything wrong.

Fields.DialogueText: The inquiry will be fair, Captain. If it's as you say, it'll be taken into account.
That will help your case in Command's eyes. I hope you're right though.
Don't be so defensive. You had at least one death as a result of this, fault or no.
Admiral, for what it's worth, the Capitano has my full confidence. We made the best of impossible circumstances.
Careful, Antoniotto. You have a... reputation... around the fleet. Responsibility is not known to be your strong suit.
Admiral, without Antoniotto our losses would have been much greater. She is willful and free-spirited, but she comes through when it matters... especially for the lives of the crew.
Hmm. And the well-being of her captain, it seems.
Well, that's what I've got. I'll keep you informed - but in the meantime, stay out of trouble. Understood?
Hmmph. Coastal patrols are getting boring. How much longer till they let us back to open ocean?
Not much longer, I think. Just remember it's less boring than sitting in dock for two weeks.
I can't believe they don't want us hunting pirates anymore. With our experience, we're the best choice for it!
It's not just us... there's politics involved in it.
Of course. Politics. Bah.
Based on the patterns of attacks and what they can tell of where Gaspard's money is coming from, there's suspicion that Le Coupe Gorge has ties to the French government. Or industry, at any rate.
He didn't strike me as very patriotic.
Maybe not. But you have a war and you get desperate people willing to consider working with unsavory characters.
Anyhow, that's a problem for the Zurich Agreement... the Fleet is supposed to stay out of the land war and the ocean truce includes not shooting at noncombatant ships.
So they're only allowing defensive engagements with Le Coupe Gorge. A ship attacking another is the only fair game.
What would you actually do if we run into them? Gaspard and company?

Fields.MenuText: I'd follow the rule. It's there for a reason.
I'd follow the rule. I'm already in hot water with Command over this.
Well, if we're thorough we can always claim they shot first.

Fields.DialogueText: Meh. Doesn't mean it's a good reason.
I suppose. I don't like it but I don't want you in trouble either.
Hah. I like that line of thinking.
Ah, finally. We have a distraction coming. Shall we?
@BATTLE
Then why are we in trouble? We couldn't have engaged them under that rule, anyway!
Yeah, well. Between handing over medicine and all the back and forth with the diamond, I suppose they want to be sure there was no impropriety.
Hm.
*ALARM*
Battle stations! All crew, battle stations!
@BATTLE
Is it safe to come out now?
Raoul, darling, it's as safe as sunshine! How are you feeling?
Much better. Antoniotto, I heard what you did for us... I am in your debt yet again.
Please, don't mention it.
Is it true, then? That you're leaving us?
Yes... I've had enough brushes with death for one lifetime.
I don't know that land will be much safer but I have some savings. Maybe it's even time to think about starting my own family.
Ooooh! Have you a lady in mind? Is she as pretty as me?
Now now, Antoniotto, you're making him blush.
Oh, Capitano, you were listening?
A bit. So you're off when we're back at port?
Yes. My debt of thanks extends to you as well, Captain. I don't envy you staying out here. Have you thought much about after the war?

Fields.MenuText: I expect I'll probably still be working with Antoniotto.
I wouldn't mind retiring myself.
I don't know. But brushes with death do get you thinking about what's really important.

Fields.DialogueText: Aw, you flatter me, Capitano.
To land? Aw, but that would break up our might pirate-hunting team.
Hm. Yes.
Oh, Raoul, you'll still come to our dinner party tomorrow night, right? Plenty of wine and all the delicacies!
Of course! Especially if you're providing the entertainment!
These Morganas are itching to be taught a lesson.
Don't do anything reckless.
@BATTLE
All right, one less pest. Everyone, let's get cleaned up and down to the mess hall! Don't want the food going cold!
So when I said invite whoever you want, I admit I pictured a more... intimate gathering.
Well, it did rule out having things like caviar and oysters. But while I do sometimes play favorites, I couldn't imagine leaving anyone out of this.
Well, between you and our cooks you've still planned an impressive spread.
I know! Oxtail stew, seafood salad, spaghetti alla bottarga, roast peppers with cheese... Italy shall be well represented tonight.
And wine. Let's not forget about the wine.
You don't even have to twist my arm about allowing the alcohol tonight.
And you'll be right in the center of it with me - right, Capitano?
Er...

Fields.MenuText: I'm really not a big drinker.
I'm not sure what that will do for my dignity.
... Oh, what the hell. Salute!

Fields.DialogueText: Oh I'm sure you can make it through a glass or two...or three. No? At least a toast?
Honestly, I think it would improve your reputation with the crew.
Woo! Salute! Bevelio tutto!
Some Time Later
*APPLAUSE*
All right everyone, heads out of your glasses for a moment.
We're all here tonight celebrating the fact that we're damn lucky to be alive and we owe a good deal of that to the lady of our ship.
*APPLAUSE*
Now word's gotten around that she gave up a load of her finery to get supplies for us.
*smirk*
So to make it up to her a bit we took up a collection. I daresay it's not as fancy as what you're used to...
But it's a gift from all of us to you, Antoniotto. Here.
Oh! A gold necklace! And the pendant is an anchor! How adorable!
*sniff* Damn it, you're gonna make me cry. More wine! A toast! To us!
If I may, Midshipman? To Antoniotto!
To Antoniotto!
uuugh...
Overdid the partying last night, Captain?
It's actually my stomach that's rebelling. It's possible I've lost the capacity to digest real food.
Hm. You know, last night might have been a one off - but I would urge you to be careful.
Oh? Why?
Antoniotto seems determined to drag you into more of these gatherings. And, with respect, you have to be aware of your standing with those under you.
If a captain acts like one of the rank and file, what will they think of you when you have to give them orders they may not like?

Fields.MenuText: I guess discipline could become an issue...
I'm sure there's a balance. Antoniotto apparently thinks I'm too far to the other side of it.
No one appreciates being lorded over either. Maybe it's better they see us as people.

Fields.DialogueText: And imagine the rift that could form between you as a result.
Antoniotto isn't the first person I'd trust about social graces.
That doesn't have to mean we act just like them.
*Antoniotto* Oh, Capitano? Are you awake and decent? We're being called out. Should I tell the galley to send up some coffee?
@BATTLE
(All right, let's try this "get to know the crew better" thing.)
Evening, folks.
Oh... Captain... hi. Is everything all right?
Fine, fine. Just having a walk through the lower decks. You?
Fiiine. ... We're off duty right now.
... Oh? Doing anything interesting?
We were thinking a few rounds of ping-pong in the rec room.
Yeah, actually we've got people waiting for us.
All right, have fun.
Damn. That was awkward.
Trouble, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: I'm starting to wonder if Davros is right about socializing with the crew.
You make this look easy. How do you manage?
No... I'm sure I'll get this if I keep trying.

Fields.DialogueText: Psh. Davros is a stick-in-the-mud. Honorable, but set in her ways. Don't take her too seriously.
Oh, I have my ways... well, honestly, it's kind of hard to explain.
I guess not everyone's a natural. But the effort matters, you know?
Hm. Antoniotto, you said something once about the crew needing to look up to me. Is there some issue I should know about?
Um...no?
Antoniotto... I know that look.
Look, I don't get the respect I do by blabbing everything I hear to the boss. And I can, if I wish, hear everything.
If I think it's important, I'll tell you. But the crew's gotta feel like they have some privacy.
On the other hand, some - like those two - are just shy around officers. Come around with me more often and we'll get them sorted.
All right...
Oops... I think we're going to have to cut that ping-pong game short. Morganas trying to sneak up on us.
@BATTLE
Phew...
Oh, Caaaaptain...
Oh dear. What are you up to now?
So I hear there is a ping pong tournament in the rec room tonight. And I bet you could stand to blow off some steam.
What if I said I had dinner plans?
I know you don't. And I already signed you up. You wanted chances to get to know the crew...
Some Time Later
All right, next on the bracket! Will Meynard, our reigning champion, stand strong in the face of tonight's special challenger, our own ship's captain?
*APPLAUSE*
Hmph. No favors for rank, we're all clear on that, right? I have no plans to give anything away.

Fields.MenuText: Don't go too hard on me, I'm not really good at this.
Favors neither asked nor given. I'll do my best and take what happens.
I don't need any favors. Give me your best shot.

Fields.DialogueText: About what I expected.
Hm, a bit of sport in you after all?
Hm, maybe our captain has some backbone after all.
What's that supposed to mean?
*PING-PONG*
Score one for the Captain!
... Ok, lucky point. Let's turn up the heat.
*PING-PONG*
And a brutal slam for Meynard!
*huff* You're *huff* enjoying this.
I would hate to let a bastard get away without taking a single shot!
*PING-PONG SLAM*
You're not talking about ping-pong, are you?
Since the privileges of rank have been waived - no, I damn well am not.
Before this gets out of hand... Capitano, I should tell you that Meynard and Grace were friends. Maybe a bit more than friends.
... I see.
Grace deserved better than what she got, Meynard. And the pirates deserved a hell of a lot worse. I know it - everybody here does.
... Okay. Okay, I'll take that. It took guts to look me in the eye and say it.
But I know I'm not the only one who wants that bastard Gaspard to get his comeuppance. If Command ever unties our hands...
I understand. Want to finish the match?
Sure. I've got a title to defend, after all.
I made the choices I made. I don't blame you if they piss you off - but they were made so we would all live long enough to see a reckoning.
Grace hasn't been forgotten. Nothing has been forgotten.
*ALARM*
I think these Morganas will make for a nice warm up!
I was thinking the same thing.
@BATTLE
You set that up, didn't you?
Since you come bearing drinks, I may admit that I had some influence in arranging the tournament bracket.
I guess I get why. And I guess I needed to hear that. Salute.
*GLASS CLINK*
Captain? Radio report. Distress call from a merchant ship. Under attack by two unidentified ships with machine guns.
Le Coupe Gorge...
That sounds like a completely obvious call for defense to me!
Right. Signal the course change to the helm and warn the crew we're headed for trouble.
Aye. I should warn that there are also still reports of Morganas in the area.
Leave it to me... as long as I can finish my drink first.
@BATTLE
The merchant ship is burning... doomed. The pirate vessels are just picking at the carcass.
Let's give them something else to do. Antoniotto, guns ready?
Aye!
This is the one warning shot they're going to get. Fire.
*BOOM*
Direct hit. She's blown apart and going down. ... Captain, the other ship is running up a white flag.
Gee, doesn't a pirate's black flag mean "give no quarter?"
Actually, that was a red flag. And they weren't technically flying any.
Captain?
Right. Contact Port Sudan - see how quickly they can get people out here to take these hyenas into custody. Keep the guns on that vessel until we get Marines over there to make sure it's secure.

As for survivors in the water - mobilize rescue crews. Infirmary on standby. Be civil, but treat everyone as a potential pirate until their identity is verified. Sorry, Davros. I'm done not taking these bastards seriously.
Captain, they're training their weapons on us!
Not a warning shot this time, Antoniotto.
*BOOM*
Morgana target in sight. They're chasing another ship...wait...
That's a Fleet frigate. And it's flying a Command flag!
Full speed to intercept!
@BATTLE
Captain. Thank you for your timely arrival, though as luck would have it, I was looking to run into you and Antoniotto.
You couldn't use the radio or wait for us in port?
Special circumstances. I have something for you.
A letter?
Gaspard has forced the League's hand.
I don't know what brilliance or madness possessed him, but he and his gang entrapped and captured a fleet ship - the Friedrich Ihn. An unmanifested destroyer in Antoniotto's size class.
My God...
Besides the embarrassment to the Fleet, even the French have been forced to admit that he is too dangerous to leave loose.
We needed a legal framework to get around the restrictions of the Zurich Agreement. So the League has voted to issue what are, essentially, letters of marque.
We, the representatives of the League of Nations, authorize the porter of this letter a fair war against...
Antoniotto, allow me.
It's in French! I can read it!
Not as well as you seem to think. "...authorize the bearer of this letter to wage extraterritorial war against..."
I'm delivering it in person because we suspect Gaspard may have spies in the Fleet. Your prior experience suits you for this task, it would be spoiled if your mission were known.
And a limited authorization to  do... a whole lot of things we normally couldn't in order to catch them...
So... basically... we are legal pirates now.
Oh?
Pirate hunting pirates.
... Oh! Oh!
When you're dancing the waltz, you must not lose your head, Ma'rm...when you're dancing the waltz...
Does she often do that?
Yep. That's Antoniotto for you.
Thank you. We get the gist.
When you're dancing the waltz, you must not lose your head Ma'rm... when you're dancing the waltz...
Ok, Antoniotto, head out of the clouds for a bit.
Oh, but this is so exciting! I wonder, when we catch Gaspard, should we take his head off with an axe too?
If we get him alive we'll be expected to bring him to trial.
"If." But it's up to us. Capitano, what would you like to see done with him?

Fields.MenuText: I want it done right. Let the court do its job.
I would be satisfied if we just send him to the bottom of the sea.
Honestly? I wouldn't mind seeing him squirm.

Fields.DialogueText: Eh. Gets the job done, I guess - but not as satisfying.
Works for me. And it ought to satisfy the crew.
That would satisfy some of the crew. On the other hand, I don't know about some of the rest.
Anyhow, before we get there we need to think this through. There's every indication he can match us in firepower - and we have to assume that Morganas will smell blood in the water and come running.
Not to mention we have to somehow find him.
Well, there are those captives from Port Sudan we're supposed to turn over to the Admiral. Wonder if he would ransom them?
I doubt it... but we need to keep interrogating them.
You have stealthy ways of communicating with the other Belles, right? Can you ask around and see if there have been any sightings?
Of course.
Oh dear... the Morganas we chased off earlier have regrouped for another try. Back to work, I guess!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
It's an ambush, sir!
We'll make sure it's unsuccessful!
@BATTLE
Nice brig you've got here.
Funny. Honestly, we haven't had to use it much... except when the below-deck parties get out of hand.
Happens less often than you think. Antoniotto's good at keeping them entertained.
Our other prisoners are still in the Doctor's custody. This man we pulled out of the water mostly in one piece.
All right, Mister. We've got questions for you.
Big surprise. Where's the lady with the fur stole and the voice?
Huh?
Antoniotto...
He looked lonely. I actually got feeling sorry for him. Was that bad?
I haven't got much to say to you Fleet types. All so upright about your ocean truce while our countries on land suffer.
Been a navy man half my life. If the Navy won't let us hit back at our enemies I'd rather sail with someone who will.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure having a cut of the spoils is a nice perk too.
He may have sold it to you that way, but Gaspard is a vicious, greedy bastard.
I'm sorry you feel that way, but the Morganas are a bigger threat.

Fields.DialogueText: Soldiers gotta get paid. Think of it as a hazard bonus.
Maybe. I don't care. He gets results.
Spoken like someone who's never seen what the Axis powers can do.
At this point, I don't care. I can see there's no getting out of this and I've got nothing worth going back to.
I guess we have to take him at his word. You will be transported to a neutral port and held in custody pending trial... once we figure out whose jurisdiction to try you under.
Captain, Lieutenant, shall we?
... I hope you find something to look forward to... even if it's a long way off.
Hmmph.
Well. We get pulled off of cleanup detail and find ourselves with a platter of fancy snacks and an audience with the Captain. What's this about?
I've called you together here because you all are some of the hardest, roughest and most sly members of this crew. And Antoniotto trusts you all.
We've got free rein and an imperative to go after Gaspard. I need ideas.
Nothing off the table?
Well, anything that would upset Davros's moral compass is unlikely to be approved. But we have some leeway to do things that would otherwise be illegal.
The trick is finding him, isn't it? He's got no reason to tangle with us again. Maybe we need a way to get him to come to us.
There are rumors that Gaspard has people in the Fleet, though our crew has been fully vetted. Could we fake otherwise?
Rumor has it people on the inside is how they got that other destroyer. But I don't know...he seems smart enough to keep track of his plants.
How about a mutiny?

Fields.MenuText: Don't sound so enthusiastic.
You mean faking a mutiny, right?
Go on...

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, we have to sell it, right?
Of course. I don't hate you enough to start one for real.
Not a real one, of course. Just a convincing one.
I'm sure we can come up with a convincing story. Arnolfo, you're one of those violence-worshiping future artists, maybe you could help sell the look of it.
I'm intrigued. The whole ship as a canvas...
What about Antoniotto? They say a Belle will never betray her captain.
But does Gaspard know that? And Antoniotto's wild reputation is also well known.
I've got pencil and paper... let's brainstorm details...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
All right. So if I were attacking I'd be standing here... and Davros would be near the bed. So three shots right... there!
*GUNFIRE*
*wince* I know we have to make this look convincing, but do we really need to be putting bullet welts in my bulkheads? Very unsightly.
And I'm not sure how I feel about being "dead" for this.
Hmph. You're a crap actor. One look at your face and the jig would be up.
And now the blood! Still wish we could have gotten real pig blood or something... you all might want to stand back.
Unf. Looks real enough. If you'll excuse me...
So what do you think, Capitano? Arnolfo can make it look good but a lot depends on you and I playing our part.

Fields.MenuText: You're a born performer. I'm sure you at least can sell it.
I'm confident we can do it.
I'm nervous for the both of us. It's a big act to pull off.

Fields.DialogueText: If need be, I'm sure I can convincingly terrorize you.
Good. I'm glad to hear it.
Heh. Well, I already know how to make you nervous. That's half of it.
Oh... damn these Morganas. They're never going to leave us to scheme in peace, are they?
Maybe they'll give us an attractive battle scar?
@BATTLE
All right. We got the pirate broadcast channel info from Admiral Turro... turns out one of our captives was willing to bargain after all.
Le Coupe Gorge has got the message. A rendezvous has been set up. We should be there in a few hours. We are expecting Gaspard to meet us in the Friedrich Ihn.
Charley, Davros, me and most of the rest of the officers will be incapacitated. If something goes wrong, you're the ranking officer until someone else can take over.
Aye, sir.
Meynard, as the ringleader, you'll have me tied up to present to Gaspard. Don't kick me too hard.
And give up the chance to take out my frustrations? But, no, if we pull this off I think I will be satisfied.
Antoniotto, the officers are secured and our "dead" are hidden?
Aye!
Froggmen hidden and prepared to repel saboteurs?
Aye.
We've struck our colors and run up the black flag?
Arnolfo even painted a skull insignia on it!
Area clear of Morganas?
Um... no.
... Should have led with that. Right, let's clear it first...
@BATTLE
Gaspard has been sighted. Your bonds are not too uncomfortable, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: It's getting dark and a bit chilly...but not too bad.
Meynard didn't spare much tightening these ropes.
There's a crude joke you could probably make here...

Fields.DialogueText: Good. Dark is useful for us if we need to sneak around.
Well, a bit of truth helps sell the lie. It shouldn't be too long...
Hah! With a sense of humor like that you can't be feeling too bad.
I should tell you there is still mist on the horizon. We might run into more Morganas.
As long as we have time to lure Gaspard in close. This time, if the Morganas attack human ships, I don't want these bastards to be able to hang back and watch.
They are close, Capitano. I can feel them.
@BATTLE
This is getting to be a pain... at least the crew is managing.
Capitano, Gaspard's men... and a woman... are coming up, but Gaspard himself isn't with them.

Fields.MenuText: That's worrying. Does he suspect something?
Probably he's just being careful...
Noted. Stick to the plan.

Fields.DialogueText: Too late to turn back now...
Maybe...
Right.
Who are you? Where's your leader?
Bonsoir. I am Settara, Gaspard's second in command.
As for Gaspard, he couldn't come right away - but he did want to listen in on our conversation. The wonders of the modern age!
*over the radio* Hello again! Exactly whom am I addressing?
Name's Meynard. Captain made a fool of us, got some of us killed and works us like a slave-driver chasing ghosts.
We got sick of it. Course we'll never be welcome on land now, so thought we might make the most of it.
They have a person in a captain's uniform with them, bound and bloodied. And it certainly looks like there has been fighting on deck.
*over the radio* So you say. What a band of merry men. What I want to know is where's the pretty little lady of the ship? They say these Belle types are very devoted to their captains.
You are partly correct. A Belle chooses her Captain. That of course implies that we might choose otherwise. My former captain has been a disgrace.
Ow! Not... the heel...
*over the radio* And what's in it for you?
You know, they say the golden age of piracy is dead. You've shown me there's a change at bringing it back to life. My wildest dreams made possible.
Think of it... Gaspard, the king of pirates, a force strong enough to stand up to even the Morganas...
... and Antoniotto, his pirate queen.
(She sounds really convincing...)
*over the radio* Hmm. Settara? Hand her the pistol.
So easily swayed by sweet words, Gaspard?
*over the radio* We'll see. I want the lady to take that pistol and put a bullet through her captain's brain.
... I'm sorry, Capitano.
Anto-!
*CLICK*
She shot at me!
It wasn't loaded!?
*over the radio* Well, shoot them back!
Jig's up! Weapons out! Signal Charley for plan B!
*GUNFIRE*
Ahhh!
Unf!
I've got you. Stay down and hold still.
You scared me for a second.
Heh. What is it they say, that good friends are worth their weight in gold? This necklace I'm wearing is more than a pretty bauble.
*ALARM*
Good, you got them all. Captain, the hatch is sprung. Meynard! I'll get the doctor!
*over the radio* Well, it was a nice plan, Captain. Unfortunately, my new toy has got you dead in its sights. I wonder if you can man your guns in time?
Oh no... the mist! Morganas!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Open fire!
@BATTLE
Midshipman, status report!
Settara and half her gang are confirmed dead. The rest are being treated. Meynard is our only casualty - we were quicker on the draw.
He'll be all right?
He's cussing fierce enough to burn Davros's ears - so, yeah, I'd say so.
I must admit, Gaspard is impressive. The Friedrich Ihn took down a Morgana ship by itself. But there is smoke coming from her.
*over the radio* You're still there? I'm not done with you sons of whores and your cabaret queen! Whether it's today or whether it's years away, I mean to finish you off!

Fields.MenuText: It's over, Gaspard. Your ship is limping. Surrender and we can at least spare your crew.
I'm not done with you yet either. We owe you some payback.
Pff.

Fields.DialogueText: *over the radio* My crew will fight you to the last. But I don't mean to let you try.
*over the radio* Come get it if you're hard enough.
*over the radio* Overconfidence will be the end of you, Captain.
*BOOM*
Aaaaaaaaaaaaah!
Antoniotto! Helm, evasive maneuvers!
Fire on the bow deck! We need suppression crews!
...right. No more Miss Nice Pirate Queen. Aim, aaaand...
*BOOM*
*over the radio* How do you like that, eh? I've got more where that came from!
*over the radio* I'll send you to the seafloor and rule the seas myself! I'll get more ships and take on the Fleet! I'll slaughter your crew and leave them for the sha-
*BOOM*
*RADIO STATIC*
...Fredrich Ihn was a minelayer. How much ordnance do you think she was still carrying?
Enough to make a very satisfying light show.
You all right?
I hurt, but I'll live. Do we have any rum?
Uuuugh. No more. Please. I am sore all over and creaking in the joints.
I've called for a rendezvous with a repair ship. There's an island two hours out where we can park and rest for a while.
Some Time Later
You are both vis-a-vis, Let your fingers entwine, you've always got room for a second glass of wine...
That's your third.
Details! Sun, a deserted island, plenty of drink and nothing to do for a while. The pirate's life for me!
May I join this little deckside drinking party?
By all means.
Salut. To the Captain and the Pirate Queen.
Salute!
Ahem.
I'm glad you're all all right. Truly. It's discomforting to hear so many explosions when you're hiding in a closet playing dead.
Now, somebody, please, tell me when you intended to let me out?

Fields.MenuText: ... Oops?
Davros, I'm so sorry...
We figured you deserved the rest.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Hell. Pass me the wine.
